title: Air Canada flight attendants’ strike ruled illegal by industrial board
summary: Arbitrator orders 10,000 striking staff back to work after government intervenes – unconstitutionally union says Canada ’s industrial relations board has declared a strike by 10,000 flight attendants illegal and ordered them back to work as the federal government seeks to end a bitter contract dispute that has halted hundreds of summer flights and stranded travellers around the world. Flight attendants with Air Canada went on strike on Saturday after months of failed negotiations with Canada’s flagship carrier over wages. Ahead of the work stoppage, Air Canada warned that a shutdown could affect 130,000 people a day. Continue reading...

title: Gupta lines up BlackRock on deal to buy key steel business out of insolvency
summary: Move sets up clash between metals magnate and creditors including UBS that are owed hundreds of millions of dollars
